tag: html body text title span span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: The Eurofighter Typhoon benefits from a number of advances in technology and engineering. The aircraft makes extensive use of

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: in the airframe with only 15% of the surface comprising metal. The newly developed

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: combined with the aircraft's aerodynamics allow it to cruise supersonically without the use of reheat for extended periods of time even with a normal weapons load. The advanced flight control system and

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: design impart great manoeuvrability at high and low speeds. These, combined with; cutting edge

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: , advanced active and passive sensors, leading cockpit ergonomics and a reduced RCS instil Eurofighter with more than an even chance of success against most competing aircraft.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Beyond present and near-future threats a key feature of Eurofighter development has been a committment to future enhancement of all its systems, the so called

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: rogramme. Most of the aircrafts systems are specifically designed to be easily swapped out and replaced in future years. This should enable the Typhoon to remain competitive as improvements in technology and reductions in cost allow the fitting of more advanced equipment. Many of these potential system upgrades are covered on this site.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td h1 span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: The Eurofighter project has been subject to several operational evaluations. These have been carried out, independently from the Eurofighter consortium, primarily by Britain's

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: gency (now split into QinetiQ and DSTL). Unlike many previous theoretical operational capability studies, the Eurofighter analysis utilised a

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: simulation approach. This was achieved through a number of networked battle simulation computers, termed

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr th span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td table tbody tr td span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: This system was used to comprehensively evaluate the

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p a span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: performance of the Eurofighter and other aircraft against an upgraded Su-27 Flanker (comparable to an Su-35 Super Flanker and its equivalents). The studies investigated all aspect best performances from the major systems on each aircraft; avionics, structure (including RCS data), engine performance (including fuel usage), defences and man-machine interfaces. In these tests the French Rafale utilised the Matra-BAe MICA air to air missile (which is the primary AA weapon of the French airforce) while the other aircraft used the Raytheon-Hughes AMRAAM.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: These simulations concluded that Eurofighter has a win rating of 82% (100% equals always win, 0% equals always lose, 50% equals parity) against the target aircraft. A more typical way to present this data is as a combat exchange ratio, for the Typhoon this equals

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p b span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: . In other words statistically one Eurofighter would be lost for every 4.5 Su-35 fighters shot down. This compares extremely favourably to the other aircraft (see also the BVR Combat Rating table);

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: (0.4:1, NB this is not the current F-18E/F which is apparently a downgraded version of the F-18+ used in the studies) and Dassault

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: bettered the Eurofighter's performance with a combat exchange ratio of 10.1:1.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: In addition to these overall combat performance results a number of

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: have been made available. Of enormous importance for BVR combat is acceleration at medium altitudes and here the Eurofighter's acceleration at Mach 0.9 and 22,000ft equals that of the F-22. At supersonic velocities (Mach 1.6 and 36,000ft) the sustained turn rate of the Eurofighter betters all but the F-22, while its instantaneous turn rate is superior to the F-22. At low altitudes, Eurofighter can accelerate from 200kts to Mach 1.0 in under 30 seconds. In a similar vain to its supersonic performance, the sustained and instantaneous subsonic turn rates of the Eurofighter are bettered only by the F-22. Only the Rafale comes close to the matching the Eurofighter's capabilities in these comparisons.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: An important point to keep in mind when examining this data is that full details on the simulations have not been released. Without this information it is not possible to determine whether Eurofighter optimal profiles were examined at the expense of more

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p i span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: combat missions. However these studies do give some indication as to the potential of the Typhoon.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td h1 span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: When selecting a fighter aircraft national airforces have to compare and contrast numerous criteria; technological, operational and political. This section gives you some idea of how changing the basic requirements of a fighter can effect the selection process. Of course in practice a fighter is chosen on more than some simple estimation of performance of a few key indicators. The recent South Korean process is a good example of how other factors can override any decision based purely on technical and compatibility grounds.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: Please note the method of defining each aircrafts capability for a given criteria is purely empirical, being manually estimated from available data, reports and other factors. We bear no responsbility should a national airforce use this application to select their fighter aircraft!

content: As you can see, even a simple analysis can result in some significant differences in the selection depending on which criteria are important in a given situation. This also shows that while the Typhoon does not typically dominate in any one area it does compare well when looking at swing role operations, i.e. combinations of both air to air and air to ground operations. This is particularly true when cost is also considered.

tag: html body text table tbody tr td h1 span
html body text table tbody tr td p span
content: The following tables detail some basic performance data. It should however be remembered that all of these figures are drawn from anticipated/expected performances as required by contractual obligations. At this time much of this data has been verified or indeed surpassed. The range data in particular though should be considered approximate rather than final.
